communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any statements of financial disclosure -- including but in no way limited to supporting documentation, such as exhibits; notices of delinquency; notices of civil assessments; terms of settlements of complaints or referrals that include a fine, penalty, or other remedy; records required to be made publicly available under the Lobbying Act; and Substantial Basis Investigation Reports issued by the Commission on Ethics -- for the following individuals:

 - Allen Riley, chair, State Commission of Correction
 - Yolanda Canty, commissioner, State Commission of Correction
 - Thomas Loughren, former commissioner, State Commission of Correction
 - Terrance Moran, former director of operations, State Commission of Correction
 - Keith Zobel, deputy director of operations, State Commission of Correction

Please note that while I've listed these individuals' latest available titles, I am interested in any such records filed during the course of their civil service.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - The Paris Review
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning quarterly English-language literary magazine The Paris Review (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Paris_Review ).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader
